intro.heading: Why Web Apps Matter in 2026
intro.paragraph1: You've heard the terms thrown around—website, web app—but what's the real difference, and why should you care?
intro.paragraph2: A traditional website is like a digital brochure: it displays information, looks pretty, and sits there waiting for visitors. It's static. Built with basic HTML, CSS, and maybe a sprinkle of JavaScript, it does one job—show content.
intro.paragraph3: A web application, on the other hand, is dynamic, interactive, and alive. It doesn't just show you a menu—it lets you filter dishes by dietary preference, calculates your order total in real-time, and remembers your favorite items. It doesn't just display contact info—it validates your form inputs, prevents errors before you hit send, and provides instant feedback.
intro.paragraph4: Think of the difference this way: a website is a poster on a wall. A web app is a conversation.
websitePoints: Loads an entire new page on every click
Hard to scale or add features later
webappPoints: Fast, app-like feel (like using Instagram or Gmail)
Built with React, TypeScript, modern frameworks
Easy to expand—add e-commerce, dashboards, integrations
intro.closingHeading: What This Means for Your Business
intro.closingText: In 2026, your customers expect speed, interactivity, and seamless experiences. They won't wait 3 seconds for a page to load. They won't tolerate clunky forms or outdated interfaces. A web app doesn't just look modern—it performs modern. It's not about following trends; it's about meeting expectations. Every project below is built as a web application—fast, scalable, and ready for whatever comes next.

puntomigrare.title: Punto Migrare
puntomigrare.description: A comprehensive platform for an immigration assistance center. The site is designed to organize complex bureaucratic information into an accessible and user-friendly interface. It features custom forms for client inquiries and modal interactions to provide quick access to essential services without navigating away from the main content.

psychologist.title: Psychologist Portfolio
psychologist.description: A serene and professional digital presence for a clinical psychologist. The design focuses on building trust through a calming color palette and clear typography. It includes sections for therapy services, professional background, and an easy-to-use contact method for scheduling appointments.

sartoria.title: Sartoria Vio
sartoria.description: An elegant showcase for a bespoke tailoring atelier in Rome. The website reflects the precision and artistry of the craft, utilizing high-quality imagery and a sophisticated layout. It serves as a digital portfolio for the tailor's finest work.

restaurant.title: Ristorante 13
restaurant.description: A vibrant website for a modern Roman restaurant. Key features include an interactive digital menu, a photo gallery of signature dishes, and seamless integration for table reservations. The mobile-first approach ensures customers can easily view the menu on their phones.

ctx.title: CTX Fintech Template
ctx.description: A cutting-edge fintech dashboard template designed for modern financial applications. It demonstrates complex UI components, data visualization layouts, and a sleek dark-mode aesthetic suitable for trading platforms or crypto wallets.

velvet.title: Velvet Shaker
velvet.description: A stylish and atmospheric website for a premium cocktail bar. The design uses rich visuals and smooth animations to capture the mood of the venue. It includes a drink menu showcase and event information.
